body.p:
John Welch a soldier is Condemned to be hung on the 22 Inst I had heard so much of the poor fellow on the 6th of this month I went to the Jail to See him -- and have a talk with him and I confess to you Sir, That I beleave Every word he says. he has told but but one tale -- and tells it like a man telling the truth -- He Says Some few days -- before he had the difficulty -- which ended in the killing of this poor strumpet -- He Welch was in the suburbs of the city & asked the man with whom -- He subsequently had the difficulty with -- If He could tell him where a soldier cant could get a drink of whiskey -- He was told he did not know of any place just there, but if He would go with him He could get him some -- and he could show him some nice women. who were all right & safe -- Welch says he went
went with him & got some whiskey -- and had an introduction to some women -- and the fellow left him alone with one of them and when He Welch went to leave He was asked to return again by the man who carried him there -- and the woman also -- after the laps of a short time Welch returned to the Same place and after being there and drinking freely he says he became verry drunk & he says the man Commenced abusing him and drew an axe -- upon him and threatened to split his brains out he Welch, told ^him^ not ^to^ strike him If He did he would shoot him -- Welch backing and absolutely backed out of the enclosure -- The fellow running striking at him -- He shot at the man who was trying to kill him -- with the axe -- Missing him and the ball taking effect in the woman -- The whole thing was a plot no doubt to get the poor soldier to this den of whores get him drunk get his money -- and swear each other
out of any difficulty -- that might occur the whole testimony come from the lips of the dirtyest set of prostitutes -- that ever disgraced any Country I hope you will feel that this poor fellows case may come under the rule that will allow you, sir, to interpose in his case and save him from death -- Good God the Idea of having such Creatures in Court to swear away the life of an individual -- upon whose features is stamped -- the man of generous heart and noble bearing, it is the first offence of any character it is said that he ever committed -- and did not know that the woman was hurt until the next day after it occured
